notesStmt.note: Gaps after folios: 6, 118, 152, 210 and 294. Some margins slightly water-damaged. Folios 283-294 partly damaged and/or stained.

Elḥakhim ben Avraham: inscribed in a note, folio 1r. Eli᾿av ben Avraham, Eli῾ezer Leṿi ben Barukh Leṿi Ḳayam, Yeshu῾ah Leṿi ben Shelomoh ha-Zaḳen: inscribed in a note, folio 320v. The record of the last name is dated 1815.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: An Arabic commentary on the books of Kings.

msItem.title: Commentary on the books of Kings

collation.p: 32 quires, nos. 1-12, 14-33, of mostly 10 laeves each. Quire no. 34 has only 3 leaves. Signatures in Hebrew letters and Arabic words on the upper margin of the first page of a quire, and in Hebrew letters at the ends of the quires. Missing quire no. 13. Quires 1, 17, 23, 32 are defective.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Semi-cursive script of the 19th century. Yosef Berakhah: inscribed in the colophon, folio 320v.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine title: 'Commentary on Kings. Arabic. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2500.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), a antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 08 July 1882, folio [321v].
